intro: Navarretia incisa, commonly known as the narrowleaf navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open, sunny habitats. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to thrive in dry, coastal climates. Navarretia incisa is known for its rapid growth and ability to bloom early in the spring.
